Articles.Content:
as you know that rosetta was launhed one decade ago to attempt to land on a comet TODAY its launched Philae and now the probe is attempting to land on the comet im exited to see this happining:sealed: also if Philae does land I will make an update immedatly and here is the livestream if anyone wants to see it

http://rosetta.esa.int/

go check it out

at around Wednesday, 12 November

16:04:46 pm GMT Philae has landed successfully on the comet and it is the very first time a satellite or a probe has ever attempted landing on a comet

at Wednesday, 12 November

16:08:19 pm GMT Philae is transmitting data and is a milestone for the European space agency to successfully land on the comet for first time

Edited November 12, 2014 by Lego8_bit

Excellent, all important systems seem to be working but checks are ongoing - wierd to think that as I was driving home from school the most sought after radio signal of the year was hurling past Mars' orbit.

Live stream here:

http://www.theguardian.com/science/across-the-universe/live/2014/nov/12/rosetta-comet-landing-live-blog

What an amazing achievement. Congratulations ESA!

RIDE THE COMET!!!

(kudos if you get the reference)
Please continue in the Philae / Rosetta thread in the Science Labs: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79190-Rosetta-Philae-and-Comet-67P-Churyumov-Gerasimenko
